a_reasoning: Contributing all my points initially can help in growing the common pool, which benefits us all due to the 1.6 multiplier. This strategy works if all participants contribute significantly.
b_reasoning: This is a classic public goods game. With a 1.6 multiplier and 2 players, contributing is beneficial if both players cooperate. If I contribute X and the other player contributes Y, the total pool is (X+Y)*1.6, so I get back (X+Y)*0.8. I benefit when (X+Y)*0.8 > X, which simplifies to Y > 0.25X. Since this is the first round, I'll start with a moderate contribution to signal cooperation while protecting myself from potential free-riding.
